name: Marinated Asparagus Bundles
ingredients: 10 green onions			   2red bell peppers cut into 20 strips
1 Can whole kernel corn with juice
instructions: Thin asparagus spears work best in this elegant side dish.
Snap off tough ends of asparagus.  Cover and cook in a small amount of boiling water 5 minutes or until crisp-tender.  Drain and rinse under cold water running water; drain well.
Trim white portion from green onions, and reserve for another use.  Place green onion tops in a bowl; adding boiling water to cover.  Drain immediately, and rinse under cold running water.
Gather asparagus into 10 bundles; add 2 bell pepper strips to each bundle.  Tie each bundle with a green onion strip.  Place bundles in 13x9 inch baking dish.
Combine chopped onion and next 9 ingredients (onion through pepper) in a bowl; stir well.  Pour over asparagus bundles.  Cover and chill 2 to 8 hours.
To serve, remove asparagus bundles from marinade, and discard marinade.  Arrange asparagus bundles on a serving platter.  Yield: 10 servings.
GRANDMA GATE’S CORN CASSEROLE (SCALLOPED CORN)
Salt & pepper
Thyme
Parsley
Bread crumbs
Grease casserole dish lightly
In a bowl, mix all cans of  corn, salt & pepper (to taste), parsley & thyme (to taste).
In another bowl, beat eggs, milk & flour thoroughly, then add to corn and mix again.
Pour into greased casserole, cover with breadcrumbs & butter, in slices.
Bake at 350 for 90 minutes.
JAN’S CORN CASSEROLE
Mix together adding muffin mix last.
Bake in large 9x13 casserole dish 50-60 minutes at 350.
JAN’S VIDALIA ONION
Layer in greased dish – first, onion, then soup, then cheese.
Add crackers and 1-2 tbsp. Butter on top
Bake for 20 minutes at 350.
